ideaBrowser.note: IdeaBrowser.com blocked by Vercel security checkpoint — unable to retrieve today's idea.

forgeLabs.problem: California AB 489, Texas TRAIGA, and Colorado AI Act all took effect Jan-Jun 2026. Every health app, patient portal, and AI chatbot now needs specific disclosure language or faces enforcement. No simple tool exists to audit compliance across states.
forgeLabs.solution: Chrome extension + web dashboard that scans patient-facing AI interfaces (chatbots, portals, telehealth) for required disclosure language by jurisdiction. Flags missing disclosures, generates compliant copy, tracks state-by-state requirements as they evolve.
forgeLabs.moat: Continuously updated regulatory database (state bills are public but fragmented). FORGE's healthcare regulatory expertise. First-mover in multi-state AI disclosure compliance tooling.
forgeLabs.dataSource: State legislature APIs, public bill text (LegiScan), ONC HTI-1 requirements, CMS guidance docs — all free, public, but nobody is aggregating them into actionable checklists.
forgeLabs.competitionCheck: Checked Chrome Web Store and app stores — zero dedicated tools for healthcare AI disclosure compliance. Big compliance firms (Akerman, BakerDonelson) write blogs but sell $500/hr advisory. No self-service SaaS.
forgeLabs.buildTime: 2-3 nights (Chrome extension + simple dashboard + regulatory JSON database)
forgeLabs.deployTo: Chrome Web Store (primary), web app (dashboard), Azure Marketplace (enterprise tier)
forgeLabs.monetization: Free tier: 5 scans/month, 1 state. Pro $49/mo: unlimited scans, all states, alerts on new laws. Enterprise $199/mo: API access, audit reports, custom jurisdictions.

articles.title: Sutter Health Collaborates with OpenEvidence to Integrate AI-Powered Clinical Decision Support into Epic Workflows
articles.takeaway: Sutter Health embedding AI-powered evidence search directly into Epic — natural language queries for peer-reviewed literature at point of care. This is exactly the CDS integration layer where LUMEN SDK sits: who validates the AI output before it reaches the clinician?
articles.linkedInAngle: Sutter is doing it right — embedding AI evidence into clinical workflows. But here's the question nobody's asking: who validates the AI's recommendation before it reaches the clinician? That's the governance gap LUMEN was built to fill.

articles.title: New Year, New AI Rules: Healthcare AI Laws Now in Effect
articles.takeaway: California AB 489 (no AI impersonating doctors), Texas TRAIGA (mandatory patient disclosure of AI use), Colorado AI Act (impact assessments for high-risk AI) — all effective 2026. Multi-state compliance is now mandatory, not optional.
articles.linkedInAngle: Three states, three different AI disclosure requirements, all effective NOW. If your health AI touches patients in CA, TX, or CO — you need runtime governance, not just a policy document. This is where embeddable compliance SDKs become essential.

articles.title: HTI-1 Final Rule: Algorithm Transparency Requirements for Certified Health IT
articles.takeaway: ONC's HTI-1 now requires transparency on AI algorithm fairness, validity, effectiveness, and safety for certified health IT covering 96% of US hospitals. USCDI v3 adoption mandatory. This creates a massive compliance surface that LUMEN's scoring framework directly addresses.
articles.linkedInAngle: 96% of US hospitals now face mandatory AI transparency requirements under HTI-1. The question isn't whether to govern AI — it's HOW to do it at runtime, at scale, without breaking clinical workflows.

linkedInPulse.note: Search returned aggregate trends rather than specific posts. Key theme: healthcare AI leaders on LinkedIn are discussing the shift from 'pilot purgatory' to production governance — exactly FORGE's Activation Bridge positioning.

events.name: Healthcare AI Summit
events.relevance: High — governance and decision support focus. Good networking with CIOs.

events.name: HIMSS Global Health Conference & Exhibition
events.relevance: Critical — largest health IT event. LUMEN SDK launch opportunity. CIO target-rich environment.

events.name: AI for Hospitals & Health Plans Summit
events.relevance: High — clinical decision support, regulatory frameworks, case studies. Perfect LUMEN audience.

video.title: Clinical AI Governance: What Clinicians Must Know in 2026
video.takeaway: Oncology and policy leaders discussing FDA clearance vs approval, model drift, LDTs, and why implementation (not innovation) limits safe scaling. Directly validates LUMEN's positioning — governance at runtime is the bottleneck.

mindset.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now. But the real advantage? Knowing exactly where to plant it.
mindset.reflection: Sean — three states just mandated AI disclosure in healthcare. HTI-1 is live. Sutter is embedding AI into Epic. The market is moving from 'should we govern AI?' to 'HOW do we govern AI at runtime?' That's not a trend — that's a runway being built under your feet. LUMEN isn't early anymore. It's on time.
